test_cases.sentence: Caelum pulchrum est.
test_cases.expected_translation: The sky is beautiful.
test_cases.translation: The sky is beautiful.

test_cases.sentence: Puer discipulus malus est.
test_cases.expected_translation: The boy is a bad student.
test_cases.translation: The boy is a bad student.

test_cases.sentence: Copiae amiserunt bellum.
test_cases.expected_translation: The troops lost the war.
test_cases.translation: The troops lost the war.

test_cases.sentence: Pater laudabat filium.
test_cases.expected_translation: The father was praising his son.
test_cases.translation: The father was praising his son.

test_cases.sentence: Marcus Brutus tradidit suum amicum.
test_cases.expected_translation: Marcus Brutus betrayed his friend.
test_cases.translation: Marcus Brutus betrayed his friend.

test_cases.sentence: Ego optimus miles eram.
test_cases.expected_translation: I was the best student.
test_cases.translation: I was the best student

test_cases.sentence: Quae scelera videmus?
test_cases.expected_translation: What evil deed do we see?
test_cases.translation: What evil deed do we see?

test_cases.sentence: Malum consilium est.
test_cases.expected_translation: The plan is bad.
test_cases.translation: The plan is bad

test_cases.sentence: Sum amicus eius
test_cases.expected_translation: I am his friend.
test_cases.translation: I am his friend

test_cases.sentence: Brutus te laudavit
test_cases.expected_translation: Brutus praised you.
test_cases.translation: Brutus praised you

test_cases.sentence: Patria delebatur
test_cases.expected_translation: The country was being destroyed.
test_cases.translation: The country was being destroyed

test_cases.sentence: Domus ustus erat.
test_cases.expected_translation: The home had been burned down.
test_cases.translation: The home had been burned down.

test_cases.sentence: Gladiator praemium vicit.
test_cases.expected_translation: The gladiator won a prize.
test_cases.translation: The gladiator won a prize.

test_cases.sentence: Vita eius erat nimis brevis.
test_cases.expected_translation: Her life was too brief.
test_cases.translation: Her life was too brief.

test_cases.sentence: Panis fuit bonus.
test_cases.expected_translation: The bread was good.
test_cases.translation: The bread was good.

test_cases.sentence: Post paucas horas Caesar Asiam cepit
test_cases.expected_translation: After a few hours, Caesar captured Asia.
test_cases.translation: After a few hours, Caesar captured Asia.

test_cases.sentence: Mater beatum infantem bene curat.
test_cases.expected_translation: The mother cares well for the fortunate baby.
test_cases.translation: The mother cares well for the fortunate baby.

test_cases.sentence: Imperator non curat de salute suae nationis.
test_cases.expected_translation: The emperor does not care for the safety of his own people.
test_cases.translation: The emperor does not care for the safety of his own people.

test_cases.sentence: Mater paterque suos pueros neglexerunt.
test_cases.expected_translation: The mother and father neglected their children.
test_cases.translation: The mother and father neglected their children.

test_cases.sentence: Puer miser ab animali saevo necatus erat.
test_cases.expected_translation: The poor boy had been killed by a savage animal.
test_cases.translation: The poor boy had been killed by a savage animal.

test_cases.sentence: Venator ursam post longam pugnam necavit.
test_cases.expected_translation: The hunter killed the bear after a long battle.
test_cases.translation: The hunter killed the bear after a long battle.

test_cases.sentence: Post redierunt Romam, nautae usi sunt otium.
test_cases.expected_translation: After they returned to Rome, the sailors enjoyed leisure time.
test_cases.translation: After they returned to Rome, the sailors enjoyed leisure time.

test_cases.sentence: Puella est laeta videre suum fratrem minorem.
test_cases.expected_translation: The girl is happy to see her younger brother.
test_cases.translation: The girl is happy to see her younger brother.

test_cases.sentence: Navis confractus est ab hostibus Romae.
test_cases.expected_translation: The ship was broken by the enemies of Rome.
test_cases.translation: The ship was broken by the enemies of Rome

test_cases.sentence: Heros erat qui multos cives servavit.
test_cases.expected_translation: He was a hero who saved many citizens.
test_cases.translation: He was a hero who saved many citizens.

test_cases.sentence: Urbs ab hostibus malis victa deletaque est.
test_cases.expected_translation: The city was conquered and destroyed by the wicked enemy.
test_cases.translation: The city was conquered and destroyed by the wicked enemy.

test_cases.sentence: Magna facta discipulorum eius magistro veteri placuerunt.
test_cases.expected_translation: The great achievements of his students pleased the old teacher.
test_cases.translation: The great achievements of his students pleased the old teacher.

test_cases.sentence: Puellae iuveni curiosaeque libet in agros migrare.
test_cases.expected_translation: The young and curious girl likes to wander into fields.
test_cases.translation: The young and curious girl likes to wander into fields.

test_cases.sentence: Sol ita lucet ut fruges celeriter crescant.
test_cases.expected_translation: The sun shines in such a way that the crops grow quickly.
test_cases.translation: The sun shines in such a way that the crops grow quickly.

test_cases.sentence: Imperator iussit milites interficere sine misericordia.
test_cases.expected_translation: The emperor ordered the soldiers to kill without mercy.
test_cases.translation: The emperor ordered the soldiers to kill without mercy.

test_cases.sentence: Princeps sensit fas suum custodire patriam.
test_cases.expected_translation: The ruler felt it was his sacred duty to protect his country.
test_cases.translation: The ruler felt it was his sacred duty to protect his country.

test_cases.sentence: Amici Scipionis invitaverunt ad cenam post victoriam magnam vixit.
test_cases.expected_translation: Scipio's friends invited him to dinner after he won a great victory.
test_cases.translation: Scipio's friends invited him to dinner after he won a great victory.

test_cases.sentence: Vir egit gratias Venerem uxori pulchrae et Iunonem liberis.
test_cases.expected_translation: The man gave thanks to Venus for his beautiful wife and to Juno for his children.
test_cases.translation: The man gave thanks to Venus for his beautiful wife and to Juno for his children.

test_cases.sentence: Sceleratus vehemens expulsus erat sicut poena vitae vitiosae.
test_cases.expected_translation: The violent criminal was exiled as punishment for a life full of vice.
test_cases.translation: The violent criminal was exiled as punishment for a life full of vice.

test_cases.sentence: Fabulae a patre eorum narratae sororem fratremque oblectaverunt.
test_cases.expected_translation: The stories told by their father delighted the brother and sister.
test_cases.translation: The stories told by their father delighted the brother and sister.

test_cases.sentence: Cupiditate aeterna devotus, desidero aliquam quae non desiderat me.
test_cases.expected_translation: Accursed by eternal longing, I long for someone who does not long for me.
test_cases.translation: Accursed by eternal longing, I long for someone who does not long for me.

test_cases.sentence: Cum peste adfecti essent, boves iam moriebantur.
test_cases.expected_translation: Since they had been afflicted by the plague, the cows soon died.
test_cases.translation: Since they had been afflicted by the plague, the cows soon died.

test_cases.sentence: Puella puero nervoso dixit se reddere amorem eius.
test_cases.expected_translation: The girl told the nervous boy that she returned his love.
test_cases.translation: The girl told the nervous boy that she returned his love.

test_cases.sentence: Cum bellum tandem vicissent, cives magno gaudio celebrabant.
test_cases.expected_translation: When at last they had won the war, the citizens celebrated with great joy.
test_cases.translation: When at last they had won the war, the citizens celebrated with great joy.

test_cases.sentence: Umbra uxoris mortuae illum miserum ita persequitur ut otium numquam reperiat.
test_cases.expected_translation: The ghost of his dead wife haunts that wretched man so that he will never find peace.
test_cases.translation: The ghost of his dead wife haunts that wretched man so that he will never find peace.

test_cases.sentence: Cum nemo audiat, poeta tristis queritur dominam eum relinquisse.
test_cases.expected_translation: Although no one is listening, the sad poet laments that his mistress has abandoned him.
test_cases.translation: Although no one is listening, the sad poet laments that his mistress has abandoned him.

test_cases.sentence: Bono nuntio accepto, nuntius delectatus civibus nuntiat opem iam adventuram esse.
test_cases.expected_translation: With the good news having been received, the delighted messenger announces to the citizens that aid will soon arrive.
test_cases.translation: With the good news having been received, the delighted messenger announces to the citizens that aid will soon arrive.

test_cases.sentence: Vulgus surrexerunt fores aedis, necatatum et consauciatum multos.
test_cases.expected_translation: The mob surged the gates of the temple, killing and injuring many.
test_cases.translation: The mob surged the gates of the temple, killing and injuring many.

test_cases.sentence: Canes denique invenerunt aprum post diem longum et miserum ita venatores id potuerunt necare
test_cases.expected_translation: The dogs finally found the boar after a long, miserable day outside so the hunters could kill it.
test_cases.translation: The dogs finally found the boar after a long, miserable day outside so the hunters could kill it.

test_cases.sentence: Quod ea voluerat fratrem tam diu, puella celebravit quando mater peperit iterum.
test_cases.expected_translation: Because she had wanted a brother for such a long time, the girl celebrated when her mother gave birth again.
test_cases.translation: Because she had wanted a brother for such a long time, the girl celebrated when her mother gave birth again.

test_cases.sentence: In oratone, orator optimus fuit et igitur multas coronas laurinas vicit.
test_cases.expected_translation: In his speech, the orator was the best and accordingly, he won many wreaths of laurel.
test_cases.translation: In his speech, the orator was the best and accordingly, he won many wreaths of laurel.

test_cases.sentence: Stultitiast, mater, venatum ducere invitas canes
test_cases.expected_translation: It is foolish, mother, to lead the unwilling dogs to the hunt.
test_cases.translation: It is foolish, mother, to lead the unwilling dogs to the hunt

test_cases.sentence: Si quis metuens vivet, liber mihi non erit umquam
test_cases.expected_translation: If anyone lives in fear, he will not ever be free - in my opinion.
test_cases.translation: If anyone lives in fear, he will not ever be free - in my opinion

test_cases.sentence: imperator promisit decem milia militum celerrime discessura esse, dummodo satis copiarum reciperent.
test_cases.expected_translation: The general promises ten thousand soldiers to depart most quickly, so long as they receive satisfactory supplies.
test_cases.translation: The general promises ten thousand soldiers to depart most quickly, so long as they receive satisfactory supplies.

test_cases.sentence: Cum cūrā docet ut discipulī bene discant
test_cases.expected_translation: He teaches them with care so the students may learn well.
test_cases.translation: He teaches them with care so the students may learn well

test_cases.sentence: Sol lucet in caelo.
test_cases.expected_translation: The sun shines in the sky.
test_cases.translation: The sun shines in the sky.

test_cases.sentence: Urbs Roma in Italia est.
test_cases.expected_translation: The city of Rome is in Italy.
test_cases.translation: The city of Rome is in Italy.

test_cases.sentence: Ego in villa ambulo.
test_cases.expected_translation: I walk in the villa.
test_cases.translation: I walk in the villa.

test_cases.sentence: Annus habet duodecim menses.
test_cases.expected_translation: The year has twelve months.
test_cases.translation: The year has twelve months.

test_cases.sentence: Quid est vita sine amore?
test_cases.expected_translation: What is life without love?
test_cases.translation: What is life without love?

test_cases.sentence: O quam felix es, qui omnia perdidisti!
test_cases.expected_translation: O how fortunate you are, who have lost everything!
test_cases.translation: O how fortunate you are, who have lost everything!

test_cases.sentence: Si Roma caderet, quid faceremus?
test_cases.expected_translation: If Rome were to fall, what would we do?
test_cases.translation: If Rome were to fall, what would we do?

test_cases.sentence: Utinam pax in mundo sit.
test_cases.expected_translation: Would that there be peace in the world.
test_cases.translation: Would that there be peace in the world.

test_cases.sentence: Puellula mea in villa cantat.
test_cases.expected_translation: My little girl sings in the villa.
test_cases.translation: My little girl sings in the villa.

test_cases.sentence: Homunculus ille nihil scit.
test_cases.expected_translation: That little man knows nothing.
test_cases.translation: That little man knows nothing.

test_cases.sentence: Domine, salvum me fac.
test_cases.expected_translation: Lord, save me.
test_cases.translation: Lord, save me.

test_cases.sentence: Scientia nova in libris invenitur.
test_cases.expected_translation: New knowledge is found in books.
test_cases.translation: New knowledge is found in books.

test_cases.sentence: Ego sum lux mundi.
test_cases.expected_translation: I am the light of the world.
test_cases.translation: I am the light of the world.

test_cases.sentence: Respublica in periculis versatur.
test_cases.expected_translation: The republic is embroiled in dangers.
test_cases.translation: The republic is embroiled in dangers.

test_cases.sentence: Deus meus, quare me dereliquisti?
test_cases.expected_translation: My God, why have you forsaken me?
test_cases.translation: My God, why have you forsaken me?

test_cases.sentence: Timor Domini initium sapientiae est.
test_cases.expected_translation: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.
test_cases.translation: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.

test_cases.sentence: Ego felum in villa vidi.
test_cases.expected_translation: I saw a cat in the villa.
test_cases.translation: I saw a cat in the villa.

test_cases.sentence: Postquam milites in silvam intraverunt, ferae saevae eos insequebantur, et multi perierunt.
test_cases.expected_translation: After the soldiers entered the forest, savage beasts pursued them, and many perished.
test_cases.translation: After the soldiers entered the forest, savage beasts pursued them, and many perished.

test_cases.sentence: Cum philosophi in academia disputarent, discipuli eorum nova praecepta didicerunt.
test_cases.expected_translation: While the philosophers debated in the academy, their students learned new teachings.
test_cases.translation: While the philosophers debated in the academy, their students learned new teachings.

test_cases.sentence: Domus mea igne consumpta est.
test_cases.expected_translation: My house was consumed by fire.
test_cases.translation: My house was consumed by fire.
